item.title: Covariance between stochastic processes
item.description:
Let $dX_1$ and $dX_2$, describe the asset returns in different time intervals, $s$ and $u$.

$$ \begin{aligned} dX_1(s) & = \sigma_1 dW_1 \\ dX_2(u) & = \sigma_2 dW_2 \end{aligned} $$

Note that these processes are arithmetic and Gaussian.

We consider the returns being independent and since we are working with only one asset we have:

$$ \begin{aligned} \sigma_1 & \equiv \sigma\sqrt{t_1} \\ \sigma_2 & \equiv \sigma\sqrt{t_2} \end{aligned} $$

where $\sigma$ is the daily volatility.

Covariance between $dX_1$ and $dX_2$

The covariance between $dX_1$ and $dX_2$ is given by:

$$ \begin{aligned} COV(dX_1, dX_2) & = E[dX_1(t_1) dX_2(t_2)] \\ & = E[\sigma_1 dW_1 \sigma_2 dW_2] \end{aligned} $$

If $t_1 < t_2$ we can write:

$$ \begin{aligned} COV(dX_1, dX_2) & = E[\sigma_1 dW_1 (\sigma_1 dW_1 + \sigma_2 dW_2 - \sigma_1 dW_1)] \\ & = E[\sigma_1^2 dW_1^2 + \sigma_1 dW_1(\sigma_2 dW_2 - \sigma_1 dW_1)] \\ & = \sigma_1^2 E[dW_1^2] + E[\sigma_1 dW_1(\sigma_2 dW_2 - \sigma_1 dW_1)] \\ & = \sigma_1^2 t1 + E[\sigma_1 dW_1(\sigma_2 dW_2 - \sigma_1 dW_1)] \end{aligned} $$
